title: Estádio José de Melo
text:
Estádio José de Melo, sometimes called Stadium José de Melo, is a multi-use <a href="stadium">stadium</a> located in <a href="Rio%20Branco%2C%20Acre">Rio Branco</a>, <a href="Brazil">Brazil</a>. It is used mostly for <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> matches and as the <a href="Training%20ground%20%28association%20football%29">training ground</a> of <a href="Rio%20Branco%20Football%20Club">Rio Branco Football Club</a>. The stadium has a maximum capacity of 2,000 people and was built in 1929 (according to some sources, it was inaugurated in 1935). The stadium is owned by <a href="Rio%20Branco%20Football%20Club">Rio Branco Football Club</a> and is named after the <a href="commissioner">commissioner</a> José Francisco de Melo, who is a former player and former president of Rio Branco Football Club. He also donated the groundplot where the stadium was built.
Most <a href="Campeonato%20Acriano">Campeonato Acriano</a> matches were formerly held at Estádio José de Melo.
History.
It was built in 1935, and inaugurated on June 8 of that year.
The stadium's attendance record currently stands at 5,476, set on April 11, 1995, when <a href="Sport%20Club%20Corinthians%20Paulista">Corinthians</a> beat Rio Branco 3–0.
